page.title: 16LAPPET MILL AT CALDER VALE
page.content: In the middle of the village, next to the river is Lappet Mill. About a hundred and fifty people work in the mill. They make shawls for the Arabs. They are sent to Scotland to be finished, then to Saudi Arabia. The mill has four storeys and was built in 1835 with local stone, and has wooden floors. Many of the people who work in the mill come from Garstang and Preston but there are also many from Calder Vale itself. The mill is busy 24 hours per day, 7 days a week. There are three shifts, 6am-2pm, 2pm-10pm, 10pm-6am. At weekends, there are two shifts of 12 hours each: 6am-6pm, 6pm-6am. Once privately owned, it is now part of the Courtauld company.
